data.question: What is the main focus of the research article?
data.answer: The main focus of the research article is on H-Bond Mediated Selectivity Control of Formate versus CO during CO2 Photoreduction with Two Cooperative Cu/X Sites.

data.question: What technique was used for X-ray absorption data collection?
data.answer: X-ray absorption data were collected at Beamline 10-BM-A, B at the Advanced Photon Source (APS) at Argonne National Laboratory.

data.question: What software was used for DFT calculations?
data.answer: DFT calculations were performed using Gaussian 16 software.

data.question: What method was used to treat dispersion correction in DFT calculations?
data.answer: DFT-D3(BJ) methodologies were used to treat dispersion correction.

data.question: What was the purpose of using the SQUEEZE routine in PLATON?
data.answer: The SQUEEZE routine of PLATON was used to remove diffused electron densities resulting from residual solvent molecules from the data set.

data.question: What was the result of photocatalytic CO2 reduction to formate with Eu-bpy-Ru-40%-CuCl2?
data.answer: The formate yield reached as high as 3040 μmol g−1 in 10 h with an extremely high selectivity of 99.7%.

data.question: What was observed in the stability test of Ru-PS under synthetic conditions?
data.answer: There were almost no changes in the absorption peak at ~460 nm for either [Ru(bpydc)(bpy)2]2+-10% or [Ru(bpydc)(bpy)2]2+-40%, indicating the excellent stability of [Ru(bpydc)(bpy)2]2+ ligand under the Eu-MOF synthetic conditions.

data.question: True or False: The photocatalytic process starts from the ground-state Cu complex features.
data.answer: False. The calculated paths initiate from charge-transfer states during the process of catalytic mechanism.

data.question: What was the role of the H-bond synergy in the selectivity control toward CO2 reduction to formate?
data.answer: The H-bond synergy between two cooperative sites of the residual Cl− and copper center plays an important role in the selectivity control toward CO2 reduction to solely generate HCOOH.

data.question: True or False: The Cu center in Eu-bpy-CuCl2 is in a +1 oxidation state.
data.answer: False. The Cu center should be in a +2 oxidation state in Eu-bpy-CuCl2.
